Position:       QA Analyst
Reports To:  Director,  IT Development & Support
Location:       Toronto

Position Profile
The client develops and supports hosted and behind-the-firewall software solutions for its customers. The QA Analyst will work with the development team to enhance and support our Internet based, e-commerce software (EDI & Web Services) products. The QA Analyst will perform all aspects of the testing and quality assurance activities for each software release including developing test strategies, defining test cases, developing & executing regression tests and tracking results. The successful candidate will have a solid background in QA for internet/java solutions using a structured SDLC methodology and want to expand their QA capabilities and responsibilities.


Major Duties and Responsibilities
•    Develops test strategy for each software release based on the design specifications
•    Develops specific test plans and use cases, test data and acceptance criteria
•    Performs functional, regression and load tests using SDLC and QA standards to ensure product meets design specifications and quality objectives
•    Records test results, analyse errors, summarize defects and provide feedback to developers
•    Tracks and maintains defect logs, QA metrics and regression test results
•    Designs, implements and executes automated testing as appropriate
•    Develops a deep understanding of customer requirements and be able to provide input to the product planning / design process
•    Maintains a working knowledge of current & future QA best practices, tools and software
•    Participates in Release Design reviews
•    Creates / Refreshes Test Environments
•    Verify test results using SQL tools
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:
•    IT degree or diploma or an equivalent combination of education & experience
•    At least 3 years QA experience with development team building web applications using: JAVA, HTML, ASP, JSP, Servlets, XML
•    Strong Microsoft SQL Database knowledge
•    Strong knowledge of Internet protocols, web services
•    Experience using automated testing tools
•    Experience deploying Test Environments
•    Experience developing web, client/server or reporting applications
•    Strong ability to work independently
•    Good oral and written communications skills
•    Strong technical skills, and the desire / aptitude for continuous learning
•    Entrepreneurial spirit suited for ‘start-up’ environment and requiring flexibility to changing needs

In addition to the above, experience with the following will be an asset:
•    Multi-platform expérience – Unix, Linux, Microsoft OS
•    EDI and enterprise e-commerce
•    Multiple scripting languages including VB development

This is a full time, permanent opportunity.  If available and interested, please reply back with a copy of your resume in Word format.  If unavailable, please feel free to forward to anyone you think may be a good fit.  I look forward to hearing back from you soon.  Thanks and regards,

jamsheer@nexstaf.com
Jamsheer Avari
IT Recruitment Consultant
Nexstaf
